metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42898 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
PAC parsing in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.19.4 and 1.20.x before1.20.1 has integer overflows that may lead to remote code execution (inKDC, kadmind, or a GSS or Kerberos application server) on 32-bit platforms(which have a resultant heap-based buffer overflow), and cause a denial ofservice on other platforms. This occurs in krb5_pac_parse inlib/krb5/krb/pac.c. Heimdal before 7.7.1 has "a similar bug."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42898` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

heimdal-clients - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
heimdal-kcm - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
heimdal-kdc - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
heimdal-multidev - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
heimdal-servers - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libasn1-8-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libgssapi3-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libhcrypto4-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libhdb9-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libheimbase1-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libheimntlm0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libhx509-5-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libkadm5clnt7-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libkadm5srv8-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libkafs0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libkdc2-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libkrb5-26-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libotp0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libroken18-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libsl0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
libwind0-heimdal - 7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

krb5-admin-server - 1.16-2ubuntu0.3
krb5-gss-samples - 1.16-2ubuntu0.3
krb5-k5tls - 1.16-2ubuntu0.3
krb5-kdc - 1.16-2ubuntu0.3

libkrb5support0 - 1.16-2ubuntu0.3

criterions.comment: heimdal package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.5.0+dfsg-1ubuntu0.3').
krb5 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16-2ubuntu0.3').
samba: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
